metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: November 30, 1943  Mr. E. Burnham Chamberain  Charleston Museum  Charleston, S. C.  Acting for Mr. Homer place, Chairman of our Civic Services Committee, I am asking you to pease attend a meeting of that committee this Friday, December 3, at 5 P.M. at the Gibbes Art Gallery. Miby Burton was, until his departure from Charleston, a member of our committee, and while we are not yet ready to repace him, or to enlarge the committee, we would appreciate it very much if you would attend our meeting this Friday. We are also asking Mr. John S. Cator, Chairman of the Chamber of Commerce Committee on Post-war planning to attend with Mr. Paul N. Conant.  We have asked Mr. George W. Simons, Jr. a municipa, research, and planning engineer, of Jacksonville, Forida to attend our meeting. Mr. Simons has been retained for a number of years by Jacksonville, Forida, through his connection with the national Resources planning Board was instrumenta in setting up the County planning Board in Charleston. We are asking him to make a brief survey of our activities and future functions, and to make a preliminary report at our meeting.  Sincerely yours,  Robert N. S. Whitelaw  Director  Carolina Art  Association  RNSW:ac
